revised_title: Factors Influencing External Form of Fossil Plants: A Study on Annularia Sternberg
tldr: This article explores the factors that influence the external form of fossil plants, specifically focusing on the Palaeozoic Equisetalean genus Annularia Sternberg. The author discusses the role of sedimentary matrix compressibility and plant tissue collapse in determining the form of fossils embedded in it. The article classifies fossil plants into petrifactions, compressions, impressions, and compactions, and suggests the term "compressions" for plants with modified external forms due to vertical pressure from surrounding sediments.
